page.title: 16HOLY TRINITY CHURCH,VENTNOR.
page.content: The money to build Holy Trinity Church was provided by three sisters who could not accept the evangelical tradition of the Parish Church. Holy Trinity Church was built at the Eastern end of Ventnor close to the Parish boundary with Bonchurch and was completed in 1862. It has always had a Catholic tradition. The church has a spire which is a prominent landmark in Ventnor. The altar is in the nave. The Revd.Malcolm Pickering is also Vicar of St. Catherines. Martin Jarman is the Lay Reader. The organist is Mrs. Lisa Burndred. The Church seats 205 people and has a regular congregation of about 55. This rises to about 60 in summer. There are 8 children attached to the church. The church sends about 10% of its previous year's income to charity.
